unnormalised: Athlete biographies offer a compelling glimpse into the lives, struggles, and triumphs of individuals who have dedicated themselves to pushing the boundaries of human potential. From the bustling streets of Mumbai to the serene landscapes of the Himalayas, Indian athletes have penned remarkable stories that resonate far beyond the playing field.

unnormalised: Take, for instance, the biography of Sachin Tendulkar, "Playing It My Way." It meticulously chronicles his journey from a young boy wielding a cricket bat in Shivaji Park to becoming a global icon, the 'God of Cricket.' The book details the pressures of expectation, the sacrifices made, and the unwavering support system that propelled him to break numerous records. Tendulkar's story exemplifies the unwavering passion that fuels sporting excellence. He debuted internationally on 15/11/1989 against Pakistan.

unnormalised: Similarly, "Unbreakable," the autobiography of Mary Kom, offers a raw and honest account of her rise from humble beginnings in Manipur to becoming a multiple-time world boxing champion. The challenges she faced – poverty, societal disapproval, and the sheer physical demands of her sport – make her achievements all the more remarkable. It's a testament to the power of determination and the ability to overcome adversity. Her gold medal win at the 2014 Asian Games in Incheon is a monumental moment in Indian sports history.
